entry.title: StrokeNet
entry.content:
StrokeNetä¸­æ˜¯å¦‚ä½•è®­ç»ƒagentçš„ï¼Ÿ1024å’Œ256æ˜¯å¦‚ä½•å¯¹åº”ä¸Šbrushã€coordinateå’Œpressureï¼Ÿ

1. train_coord_encoder:

CoordinateEncoder(brush): 2->1024->1*64*64
points, bitmap = CoordinateData()
pred = CoordinateEncoder.forward(points)
loss = MSE(bitmap, pred)

2. train_generator:

StrokeGenerator: can generate an stroke image from data and points
images, data, points = Threebody(dataset_path, batch_size=32)
# data={colorï¼Œradius}, points={x,y,p}
output = StrokeGenerator(data, points)(256*256*1)
loss = MSE(images, output)
# data: length*32*2->batch_size*1*64*64
# points: length*batch_size*3-> coord, pressure
# coord: length*batch_size*2-(CoordinateEncoder)->length*batch_size*64*64 -*pressure->length*(batch_size-1)*64*64(each in {length} represents a segment of the stroke)
# feature = cat(coord, data_feature)()

3. train_agent_mnist:

Agent: can recover data and points from an image
renderer = Renderer('http://10.11.6.118:3000', size)
#
epoch in range(10)
images = data_loader(MNIST)
color_radius, action = agent(images)
# AgentCNN: batch_size*1*256*256->batch_size*256*8*8->batch_size*16384
# AgentFC: recover color_radius(color, radius), action=(coord, pressure) from input, which is output of AgentCNN
approx = StrokeGenerator(color_radius, action)
penalty = mse(action[:, 0:15], action[:, 1:16])
loss = MSE(images, approx) + penalty * LAMBDA

4. train_recurrent_agent_mnist

RecurrentGenerator
RecurrentAgent(256, 1, rg, 3)->1*256*256, 15*3
for epoch in range(10):
images = data_loader(MNIST)
approx, penalty = RecurrentAgent(images, regularizer=regularizer)
#

å­˜å¿ƒæ—¶æ—¶å¯æ­»ï¼Œè¡Œäº‹æ­¥æ­¥æ±‚ç”Ÿ

ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆLearningToPaintingä¸­è¯´model-based DDPGï¼Œä½†DDPGæ˜¯model-freeï¼Ÿ

1. model-free RL vs model-based RL
  • é©¬å°”ç§‘å¤«å†³ç­–è¿‡ç¨‹MDPï¼Œ<S,A,R,T>
    ğ‘‡(ğ‘ â€²|ğ‘ ,ğ‘) is a transition probability function, specifying the probability that the environment will transition to state ğ‘ â€² if the agent takes action ğ‘ in state ğ‘ .
  • modle-based RLè®©agentå­¦ä¹ ä¸€ç§æ¨¡å‹ï¼Œè¿™ç§æ¨¡å‹èƒ½å¤Ÿä»å®ƒçš„è§‚å¯Ÿè§’åº¦æè¿°ç¯å¢ƒæ˜¯å¦‚ä½•å·¥ä½œçš„ï¼Œç„¶ååˆ©ç”¨è¿™ä¸ªæ¨¡å‹åšå‡ºåŠ¨ä½œè§„åˆ’ã€‚å…·ä½“æ¥è¯´ï¼Œ
    å½“agentåœ¨s1çŠ¶æ€æ‰§è¡ŒåŠ¨ä½œa1a_1a1â€‹ï¼Œç„¶åè§‚å¯Ÿåˆ°äº†ä»s1s_1s1â€‹åˆ°s2s_2s2â€‹ä»¥åŠæ”¶åˆ°çš„å¥–åŠ±rrr, é‚£ä¹ˆè¿™äº›ä¿¡æ¯èƒ½å¤Ÿç”¨æ¥æé«˜å®ƒå¯¹T(s2âˆ£s1,a1)T(s_2|s_1,a_1)T(s2â€‹âˆ£s1â€‹,a1â€‹)å’ŒR(s1,a1)R(s_1,a_1)R(s1â€‹,a1â€‹)çš„ä¼°è®¡çš„å‡†ç¡®æ€§ã€‚
    è®­ç»ƒå®Œåagentå˜æˆå…¨çŸ¥å…¨èƒ½çš„ï¼Œæ¯æ¬¡åˆ©ç”¨è´ªå¿ƒç®—æ³•ï¼Œé€‰æ‹©å½“å‰çŠ¶æ€sts_tstâ€‹æœ€å¤§å€¼åŠ¨ä½œmaxa(R(s,aâˆ£s=st))max_a(R(s,a|s=s_t))maxaâ€‹(R(s,aâˆ£s=stâ€‹))
  • model-free RL è®¡ç®—å¯¹æœªæ¥å›æŠ¥Q(s,a)Q(s,a)Q(s,a)ï¼ŒQ(sk,ak)Q(s_k,a_k)Q(skâ€‹,akâ€‹)è¡¨ç¤ºå¯¹sks_kskâ€‹çŠ¶æ€ä¸‹æ‰§è¡ŒåŠ¨ä½œata_tatâ€‹åè·å¾—çš„æœªæ¥æ”¶ç›Šæ€»å’ŒE(âˆ‘t=knÎ³kRk)E(âˆ‘^n_{t=k}Î³^kR_k)E(âˆ‘t=knâ€‹Î³kRkâ€‹)çš„ä¼°è®¡ã€‚
    è®­ç»ƒç»“æŸåå¯¹Qå€¼ä¼°è®¡çš„è¶Šå‡†ç¡®ï¼Œå°±è¶Šèƒ½ç¡®å®šå¦‚ä½•é€‰æ‹©å½“å‰sts_tstâ€‹çŠ¶æ€ä¸‹çš„åŠ¨ä½œï¼šé€‰æ‹©è®©Q(st,at)Q(s_t,a_t)Q(stâ€‹,atâ€‹)æœ€å¤§çš„ata_tatâ€‹å³å¯ã€‚
    Qå€¼çš„æ›´æ–°ç›®æ ‡ç”±Bellmanæ–¹ç¨‹å®šä¹‰ï¼Œæ›´æ–°çš„æ–¹å¼å¯ä»¥æœ‰TDï¼ˆTemporal Differenceï¼‰ç­‰ï¼Œè¿™ç§æ˜¯åŸºäºå€¼è¿­ä»£çš„æ–¹æ³•ï¼Œç±»ä¼¼çš„è¿˜æœ‰åŸºäºç­–ç•¥è¿­ä»£çš„æ–¹æ³•ä»¥åŠç»“åˆå€¼è¿­ä»£å’Œç­–ç•¥è¿­ä»£çš„actor-criticæ–¹æ³•ï¼ŒåŸºç¡€çš„ç­–ç•¥è¿­ä»£æ–¹æ³•ä¸€èˆ¬å›åˆåˆ¶æ›´æ–°ï¼ˆMonte Carlo Updateï¼‰ï¼Œè¿™äº›æ–¹æ³•ç”±äºæ²¡æœ‰å»å¯¹ç¯å¢ƒè¿›è¡Œå»ºæ¨¡ï¼Œå› æ­¤ä»–ä»¬éƒ½æ˜¯Model-freeçš„æ–¹æ³•
  • åœ¨agentæ‰§è¡Œå®ƒçš„åŠ¨ä½œä¹‹å‰ï¼Œå®ƒæ˜¯å¦èƒ½å¯¹ä¸‹ä¸€æ­¥çš„çŠ¶æ€å’Œå›æŠ¥åšå‡ºé¢„æµ‹ï¼Œå¦‚æœå¯ä»¥ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆå°±æ˜¯model-basedæ–¹æ³•ï¼Œå¦‚æœä¸èƒ½ï¼Œå³ä¸ºmodel-freeæ–¹æ³•ï¼ˆ1. Model-based RL is a deductive approach for solving a problem. Agent uses its general understanding of the system to derive a best action. 2. Model-free RL is an inductive approach for solving a problem. Agent uses its past experience as empirical evidence and use frequency statistics to estimate the value of its action.ï¼‰
2. We cannot train a good-performance painting agent using original DDPG because itâ€™s hard for the agent to model the complex environment well that is composed of any types of real-world images during learning.
#### ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆLTPä¸­ç”¨äº†WGANï¼ŸWGANæ˜¯å¦‚ä½•è®­ç»ƒçš„ï¼Ÿ 1. its great ability in measuring the distribution distance between the generated data and the target data. We want to reduce the differences between paintings and target images as much as possible. In experiments, we find rewards derived from D scores is better than L2 distance.

ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆLTPä¸­ç”¨äº†ResNet_wobn?

ä»€ä¹ˆæ˜¯double Q-learningï¼Ÿ

Where can improve?

TD3ï¼šDouble Q-learningä¸­çš„æ–¹æ³•ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨ä¸€å¯¹ç‹¬ç«‹çš„ç¥ç»ç½‘ç»œä¼°è®¡criticã€‚ä½†æ˜¯è¿™ç§æ–¹æ³•è™½ç„¶èƒ½è§£å†³biasé—®é¢˜ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯åŒæ—¶ä¹Ÿä¼šå¸¦æ¥é«˜æ–¹å·®ã€‚
